corda / net.corda.contracts.testing / DummyDealContract / State / parties

parties

val parties: List<AnonymousParty>

Overrides DealState.parties

Exposes the Parties involved in a generic way.

Appears to duplicate participants a property of ContractState. However participants only holds public keys. Currently we need to hard code Party objects into ContractStates. Party objects are a wrapper for public keys which also contain some identity information about the public key owner. You can keep track of individual parties by adding a property for each one to the state, or you can append parties to the parties list if you are implementing DealState. We need to do this as identity management in Corda is currently incomplete, therefore the only way to record identity information is in the ContractStates themselves. When identity management is completed, parties to a transaction will only record public keys in the DealState and through a separate process exchange certificates to ascertain identities. Thus decoupling identities from ContractStates.
